tool.name: Full_Indicator_Tool

param.name: in_poly
param.dialogReference: The restoration site area being assessed. All other input datasets will be re-projected based on the projection used for the restoration sites. All fields and spatial data in this dataset will be copied to the output. The output table from one partial analysis can be used as input to the next.

param.name: in_pnts
param.dialogReference: People in the area around the restoration sites that could potentially receive benefits from site restoration. A buffer of 12 miles around the site will usually be enough, though the range may vary depending on the benefits chosen for assessment. Points representing individual homes should be entered as Address Points (suggested source: state E-991 address data). If a grid (raster) representation of population is being used, enter this dataset instead as "Population Raster."

param.name: popRast
param.dialogReference: People in the area around the restoration sites that could potentially receive benefits from site restoration. A buffer of 12 miles around the site will usually be enough, though the range may vary depending on the benefits chosen for assessment. Grid format representations of population should be entered as Population Raster. The suggested source for the conterminous United States is the EnviroAtlas - Dasymetric Population dataset. If address locations (points) are being used to represent the population, enter this dataset instead as "Address Points."

param.name: flood
param.dialogReference: Flood risk reduction benefits flow from where they are produced to downstream areas that would otherwise flood.

param.name: view
param.dialogReference: Scenic view benefits flow from aesthetically pleasing landscapes outward to surrounding areas.

param.name: edu
param.dialogReference: Environmental education benefits are the only benefits that can be assessed without a population dataset (addresses or population raster).

param.name: rec
param.dialogReference: Recreation benefits require people to travel to the site where recreation opportunities are to benefit. People within walking or driving distance of the site are assumed to be able to benefit.

param.name: bird
param.dialogReference: Bird watching benefits flow from where birds are outward to surrounding areas where people can see them.

param.name: socEq
param.dialogReference: The social equity of restoration sites can be compared for each benefit based on who is expected to benefit, but these will typically be similar across different benefits so it is recommended that users run social equity once for each site.

param.name: rel
param.dialogReference: A restoration site that will persist further into the future is rated as higher priority than a comparable site that is not expected to persist into the future.

param.name: flood_zone
param.dialogReference: Polygons that define flood zones (e.g. 100-yr or 500-yr) where flooding occurs. Suggested sources include FEMA and/or NOAA.

param.name: flood_sub
param.dialogReference: Point, line or polygon dataset defining flood prevention infrastructure. Suggested sources include USGS NHDPlus dataset, and/or FEMA.

param.name: edu_inst
param.dialogReference: Point dataset that defines education institutions that may receive benefits. The suggested source is the state department of education.

param.name: bus_stp
param.dialogReference: Point, line or polygon dataset that defines bus stops where people may access benefits. Suggested sources include state agencies or OpenStreetMap.

param.name: trails
param.dialogReference: Point, line or polygon dataset that defines trails where people may access benefits. Suggested sources include National Park Service, state agencies, or Non-Governmental Organizations.

param.name: roads
param.dialogReference: Point, line or polygon dataset that defines roads where people may access benefits. Suggested sources include Tiger, E911 and/or OpenStreetMap.

param.name: in_wet
param.dialogReference: Polygons that define existing wetlands. The suggested source is the FWS National Wetlands Inventory (NWI).

param.name: land_use
param.dialogReference: Polygons that define landuse or greenspace. Suggested sources include state agencies and/or NOAA.

param.name: LULCFld
param.dialogReference: Field categorizing landuse types.

param.name: grn_field_val
param.dialogReference: Values in the field which are greenspace

param.name: soc_vul_poly
param.dialogReference: Polygon dataset defining the social vulnerability of different areas. Suggested sources include the Social Vulnerability Index as provided by NOAA, CDC, or produced directly from census data.

param.name: soc_field
param.dialogReference: Field categorizing vulnerability.

param.name: soc_field_val
param.dialogReference: Values in the field which are vulnerable.

param.name: cons_poly
param.dialogReference: Polygon dataset defining areas to be conserved or otherwise protected against future threats and development. Suggested sources include state planning organizations.

param.name: Conservation_Field
param.dialogReference: Field categorizing conservation areas.

param.name: Conservation_Type
param.dialogReference: Values in the field which are protected.

param.name: outTable
param.dialogReference: A file name and location must be specified for the dataset that results from the analysis. It is recommended that users create a new file geodatabase and save their output there because the output file folder location is also used to save intermediate files. If a file saved in the specified location shares a name with any intermediate it is deleted and overwritten.

param.name: outReport
param.dialogReference: An optional PDF file report is generated from fields in the Output table (Table 10) when a PDF Report file name is specified. The layout of the PDF report is based on a Mapfile (report_layout.mxd) with the report layout in it that is downloaded as part of the toolset to the same file directory as the toolbox.

tool.summary: The Full Indicator Assessment Tool is used for the bulk of the benefits assessment. This tool streamlines the analysis, allowing datasets entered once to be used as input for multiple processes/benefits and assuming certain default files are available.
tool.usage: Calculate values for benefit indicators using two or more wetland restoration site polygons and a variety of other input data.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Full Indicator Assessment Tool is used for the bulk of the benefits assessment. This tool streamlines the analysis, allowing datasets entered once to be used as input for multiple processes/benefits and assuming certain default files are available.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Justin Bousquin, Michael Charpentier (Report generation), Marc Weber and Tad Larsen (StreamCat)

searchKeys.keyword: Full Assessment; RBI; Rapid Benefit Indicators; Ecosystem Services
